Message.Title: Up 6 Straight Days Ready to Explode!
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR), very low float, up 6 days in a row and about to explode - their MediaHawk technology is in process of being deployed by Virgin Media (VMED) a $23 billion company with 3.8 million cable TV subscribers - the largest cable TV company in the UK. CCUR will be powering VMED's new Virgin TV Anywhere platform that will deliver on demand video content to smartphones and tablets. CCUR is breaking out big and about to explode. Most bullish looking chart possible and incredible fundamentals. Huge cash position no debt. Net income is rapidly growing each quarter. CCUR's #1 competitor Seachange (SEAC) just broke $12 and hit a new 52-week high of $12.10 and now trades with an enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.93, which would value CCUR at $15.80 per share! CCUR has gross margins of 58.81% vs SEAC's gross margins of 50.18%. SEAC is a money losing company while CCUR's EPS last quarter was double the quarter before and quadruple the quarter before that! CCUR and SEAC together control more than 50% of the global video on demand (VOD) market!

Message.Title: I know nothing!
Message.Msg: But I bought a bunch of $16 strike calls for 11 cents, August expiry. $9 of cash on the books prices Dell at $5.50 net. Dell multiple is 11x earnings, 8.5x forward earnings. Without the cash they are 4x earnings. Dell is definitely worth a shot for a move to $18 or a smidge higher. A market multiple on $5.50 is $22. Does Michael want his company bought by a bunch of breakup artists? Is there a vanity factor at play?

Topic.Title: Informal Poll....

Message.Msg: $16.5 - $17.5 Microsoft will put in a few more billions along with Silverlake to make a huge overbid to put it beyond Icahn/BX. This way, 1) SE, T Rowe etc can breakeven on their shares which they bought at 16.88 and call it quits 2) ICahn makes a few million and goes away 3) BX gets to prove it made a bid (thus disproving they are evil corporate colluders) 4) Dell gets to take his company private and try to run it around (and ultimately re-ipo it at a higher price) Everyone is happy

Topic.Title: Informal Poll....

Message.Msg: I agree that BX would drop out against a higher counterbid. Icahn might stay around and match the higher price as he proposed buying only up to 58% of the outstanding stock with the rest keeping their shares. That would be a more popular option for the funds that think it is worth north of $20, including Icahn who has stated he thinks it is worth $22.60. They could stick around. The worst thing that could happen is that BX and CI join forces and bid $14.25 with the option for cash or stock with no counterbid from Silverlake. Whether the stock could get up to $20 on its own in the future after BX and CI drain the cash, load up the debt, and sell of DFS is anyone's guess.

Topic.Title: Michael Dell/SL can offer %15.65 all cash offer - and complete the LBO

Message.Msg: Why would Mike Dell increase his $13.65 (cash) per share , when no one else has made an offer to even match it, much less beat it? Mike Derll and his LBO team are not going to bid against themselves. The "offers' from Blackstone and , or Ichan, are not cash, or even solid offers. Ichan wants to borrow to paya dividend and then bankrupt the company. Blackstone wants to sell ofd Dell assets to finance their 'bid', they are trying to buy Dell with Dell's own assets. These are not serious offers or bids, these "offers' are absurd. Mike Dell is the only one stepping up to the plate with a real offer, and it is $13.65, cash. Vote yes and take it .Or, the stock trades back down to $11 per share and maybe eventually its get back up to $13.65, which might be some years, if ever. Hope this helps.

Topic.Title: dont vote for anything that doesn't allow the stockholder the option of keeping his shares

Message.Msg: Don't bote YES on the current $13.65 offer and you will definitely get to keep all your DELL shares. The company will remain public, and the share price will be in the $10.50 to $11 per share price range. from that point on all DELL stockholders can be proud that (for some reason0 they did not accept $13.65 when they had the chance. Who knows, if Mike Dell is able to transform the business , and the stock market remains strong, by 2015 or 2016 DELL stock might trade back uo to $13.65. Hope this helps.

Topic.Title: Speculation of Monday's DELL opening price due to new bids?

Message.Msg: btv, aren't you the one who wrote "$15 is the new floor'? Nonsense. The "floor" is about $10 per share, which is where DELL will immediately trade if the current $13.65 offer does not receive enough YES votes. Ichan and , or Blackstone's "offers" are absurd. Dell's Board will not take them seriously because those "offers" are not cash, or in any way solid. Hope this helps.

Topic.Title: dont vote for anything that doesn't allow the stockholder the option of keeping his shares

Message.Msg: If i wanted to sell at $13.65 i would have took the 14.50 they sold for today. I want to own my shares and have this company run by someone who is not trying skin shareholders ,that they are supposed to be representing. Michael Dell sold his company to the public and they let him run it.If he is not running it for the shareholders ,then he needs to LEAVE......

Topic.Title: Michael Dell/SL can offer %15.65 all cash offer - and complete the LBO

Message.Msg: "The "offers' from Blackstone and , or Ichan, are not cash, or even solid offers. Ichan wants to borrow to paya dividend and then bankrupt the company. Blackstone wants to sell ofd Dell assets to finance their 'bid', they are trying to buy Dell with Dell's own assets. These are not serious offers or bids, these "offers' are absurd." Get this dude...BX or Icahn dont give a ____ about what becomes of DELL. If they have the support of the shareholders, they will do whatever it takes to make money (like the debt-dividend program from Icahn or the piece by piece sale of DELL by BX). U and I dont matter..only the big boys like SouthEastern and T Rowe matter. And they have a pretty high average on their shares....unless they get close to $16.50 - $17.00, they will never go along with an all-private deal. The reason they are going along with BX's deal at the moment is because it leaves out a public stub. Considering all these, the only logical conclusion is that Dell either raises his offer to $17 or sees his company getting dismantled. I know Dell is a smart man...I even suspect this is exactly how he planned this whole thing. The next step is to get about 1.5 Billion more from Silverlake, about 3.5 billion more from Microsoft and finish the deal at around 30 B i.e around $17 per share and put it beyond both BX and Icahn. That way , 1) Icahn can take his $17 minus $14 profits and go away 2) SouthEastern and T Rowe can wash their hands off DELL and atleast breakeven for their trouble 3) M Dell can take the company private like he wanted 4) BX can prove that it was a "competitive" bidding process in which Silverlake finally won This is the only sequence of events that makes sense to me IMHO. If M Dell or Silverlake were really "caught off guard" with competing bids, it only shows gross incompetence from both of them and Dell deserves to lose DELL

Topic.Title: dont vote for anything that doesn't allow the stockholder the option of keeping his shares

Topic.Title: Michael Dell/SL can offer %15.65 all cash offer - and complete the LBO

Message.Msg: There is no reason for Mike Dell to increase his buyout offer just so johnny come lately stockholders, or shareowners who paid too much for their DELL shares, can make out better. Mike Dell is not responsible for people losing money on whatever DELL stock they own, that is their problem. Buyer beware. If his current $13.65 offer does not receive enough yes votes then the company will remain public, and if the share price declines a significant amount, Mike Dell may have the opportunity to privatize the company (for less than his current offer) at a later time. It's a win-win for Mike Dell. The Blackstone and, or, Ichan offers are not as solid as the cash deal Mike Dell is offering. Hope this helps.

Topic.Title: Michael Dell/SL can offer %15.65 all cash offer - and complete the LBO

Message.Msg: Dude, U don't seem to understand....you are talking about some vague ethics about how some investors are trying to fleece DELL. That is the least of BX's or Icahn's concerns....and that goes double for SouthEastern and T Rowe too. They are in this to make money (and in SE and T Rowe's case, to avoid losing money) They could care less about whether DELL exists 2-3 years down the line....if they are not able to get their money from M Dell/Silverlake, they will drown the company in debt and pay themselves a dividend. Anyone would do that to avoid taking losses. Afterall SE and TRowe have an avg of 16.50 on their shares Instead of arguing about some ethical standpoint, try to think from a cold-hearted business standpoint. Unless M Dell pays up, he will lose his company.

Topic.Title: Speculation of Monday's DELL opening price due to new bids?

Message.Msg: P.S. The board ruled that both proposals represent potentially better bid, they did that hours ago. The Blackstone bid is a cash tender, and extremely solid. If you wanted to complain about that and knew what you were talking about you would say that they need bank backing and that there are few that aren't involved on the Silverlake side. But, Ichan and his money look to be tending toward Blackstone. In any event, they run tremendous money and Blackstone will certainly not make fools of themselves by coming to a deal broke. They really aren't dumb. Good luck bashford. Really, I hope you do well. But you have this deal all wrong. There is plenty of capital on M Dell's side to beat the offers that the board has already deemed worthy of consideration. Yes, they need firm financing. I get it! But that's not what you are saying. And you are wrong. There are too many major holders involved to have the thing fizzle in the end. There are already known talks to roll in major investors who want to keep their shares. Hope that helps.

Topic.Title: Michael Dell/SL can offer %15.65 all cash offer - and complete the LBO

Message.Msg: It's you who does not "see the reality" here. That is, Dell's current cash reserves represent only about 105 of dell's current market cap. This "leveraged recap" you refer to would be a liquidation of Dell and result in shareowners receiving about 130% of Dell's current market cap value. In other words, DELL here at above $14 is ridiculously over valued. Mike Dell's current $13.65 per share cash offer is an extremeley generous bid. Forget about Ichan's or Blackstone's offer to 'borrow money to pay a dividend" or "liquidate Dell assest to pay off shareowners". The first will never receive financing. the econd is dependent on third party buyers willing to pay a premium for distressed Dell assets. Neither plan will ever pass any scrutiny or recieve affirmative votes. Meanwhile, Mike dell's offer is solid, all cash. Hope this helps.
